p: Similarly, several other studies have acknowledged that THCs exhibit potent anti-inflammatory activity, inhibiting LPS-induced production of NO, expression of iNOS and COX-2, proinflammatory cytokines TNF- α and IL-6, and activation of NF- κB p65 [ 28, 30, 43] with a stronger safety profile than curcumin where the production of proinflammatory mediators has been reduced and thus ameliorating inflammation [ 29]. Further, Singh and Jain [ 44] reported that THC showed significant antimicrobial activity when compared with standard drugs such as kanamycin and fluconazole for antibacterial and antifungal activities, respectively.
